intro: Cryptandra hookeri, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cryptandra, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period usually occurs in late summer to autumn, producing small yellow-green flowers that attract insects. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
